intro: Racosperma lirellatum, commonly known as the slender acacia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, featuring compound leaves and yellow flowers arranged in racemes. Its seeds are enclosed in pods, a common feature among members of the legume family. Racosperma lirellatum is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions.
